intro: Sison acaule, commonly known as the naked-stem sison, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Sison acaule is typically found in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests.
